Class Pack

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Pack
public class Pack
extends java.lang.Object

Class Pack is a collection of Cards using a arrayed List. It contains methods for creating standard Packes, adding cards to a Pack and shuffaling the Pack.

See Also:
Card, List

Method Detail

freshPack

public void freshPack()
               throws ListFullException,
                      ValueOutOfRangeException,
                      java.lang.Exception
Refreshes the Pack with an orderd set of all the standard Cards but without the Jokers. Simply calls freshPack(0)
Throws:
ListFullException - Only occurs on an Internal error.

freshPack

public void freshPack(int jokerNum)
               throws ListFullException,
                      ValueOutOfRangeException,
                      java.lang.Exception
Refreshes the Pack with an orders set of all the standard Cards with the number of Jokers specified.
Parameters:
int - The number of jokers to add to the Pack.
Throws:
ListFullException - Only occurs on an Internal error.

shufflePack

public void shufflePack()
                 throws ListEmptyException,
                        ListFullException,
                        IndexInvalidException
This rearranges the cards in the Pack so that they are in a random order. does this by calling allCards.removeAt(int) and adding the removed card to a new List. Uses randomizer to pick the index values. Also resets the dealPos so that dealing can start again.

dealCard

public Card dealCard()
              throws DealException,
                     ListEmptyException,
                     IndexInvalidException
Deals a card and increments the dealPos.
Returns:
The next Card in the List to Deal.
Throws:
DealException - If there is no more Cards to deal.
ListEmptyException - Only if there is a coding error.
IndexInvalidException - Only if there is a coding error.
